summary: This is an email chain from August 13-14, 2019, between U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman and an assistant (redacted as USANYS 3). Berman directs the preparation of a summary of forfeiture options regarding Jeffrey Epstein's properties in New York, Florida, and the Virgin Islands for a Thursday morning meeting, indicating active post-arrest asset seizure planning.

events.title: Forfeiture Options Summary Deadline
events.description: Geoffrey Berman requests a summary of forfeiture options regarding Epstein's properties to be ready by Thursday morning (August 15, 2019).

events.title: Planning for Asset Seizure
events.description: Internal email discussion within the U.S. Attorney's Office about developing a legal theory to pursue forfeiture of Epstein's residences in New York, Florida, and the U.S. Virgin Islands.

keyFacts: U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman was actively planning asset forfeiture actions against Jeffrey Epstein's properties in at least three jurisdictions (NY, FL, VI) in August 2019.
The email chain shows internal coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York shortly after Epstein's arrest, focusing on seizing his assets.
Berman sought a 'cognizable theory' to legally pursue the forfeiture of Epstein's residences, indicating a strategic legal approach was being developed.
The communication highlights the procedural steps being taken by prosecutors to secure Epstein's assets as part of the criminal case.
